newsitem.title: UK: S&P rates Mutuelles du Mans A minus claims paying.
newsitem.headline: S&P rates Mutuelles du Mans A minus claims paying.

text.p: Standard & Poors, said on Wednesday it had assigned its A minus claims paying ability rating to France's Mutuelles du Mans IARD (MMA).
S&P said the rating reflected strong management and satisfactory capitalisation, together with solid operating results and sound reserving.

"However offsetting these strengths, S&P believes that the company has a somewhat aggressive investment strategy with a large proportion of its assets invested in property and stocks," S&P said in a statement.

"Also while the company's expense ratio is in line with that of traditional insurers, it compares unfavourably with that of other domestic low cost providers, such as mutuelles without intermediaries and banks."
S&P said this reflectd it's concern over MMA's business position in the longer term which may be threatened by the absence of non-agency distribution channels.

"In the short- and medium-term, S&P expects MMA to retain its strong position in the market and post good operating results. However, given the essentially domestic nature of MMA's business, the relative absence of product differentiation in personal lines, and the increased competition from low cost producers, it is important that the company addresses the issue of distribution if it intends to remain a competitive player in the longer term," S&P said.
S&P listed the following major rating factors.
-- High investment leverage adn restricted liquidity.
-- A relatively high expense ratio. --International Bonds Unit +44 171 542 4041
